info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 19 at 7:23AM EST by NWS State College
info.description: ...A BAND OF HEAVY SNOW WILL AFFECT PARTS OF NORTHERN CENTRE... CLEARFIELD...AND CAMBRIA COUNTIES... HAZARDS...A band of heavy snow which can rapidly reduce visibility to a quarter of a mile. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 722 AM EST, a band of heavy snow was along a line extending from 16 miles northeast of Clearfield to near Greensburg and moving east at 60 MPH. THIS BAND OF HEAVY SNOW WILL BE NEAR... Pine Glen and Karthaus around 730 AM EST. Southmont around 755 AM EST. Johnstown, Scalp Level and Paint around 800 AM EST. Salix-Beauty Line Park, Sidman and St. Michael around 805 AM EST. Dunlo and Beaverdale-Lloydell around 810 AM EST. * For those driving on Interstate 80, this includes areas between the Dubois and Milesburg exits, specifically from mile markers 98 to 154. This includes the following highways... Route 22 from the Indiana County line to near Gallitzin. Route 219 between Geistown and Burnside...and between west of Mahaffey and south of DuBois, and near DuBois. Route 322 from south of DuBois to north of Port Matilda. Route 422 from the Indiana county line to Ebensburg. State Road 56 from the Westmoreland County line to Johnstown. State Road 153 from near S.B. Elliot State Park to Penfield. State Road 255 from Penfield to north of Penfield. State Road 350 from Philipsburg to near Bald Eagle. The Johnstown Expressway. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this band of heavy snow. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&
